ingredients: 1 kg Mutton (bone-in, preferably from the shoulder or leg)

steps.title: Prepare the marinade
steps.description: In a large bowl, mix yogurt, ginger paste, garlic paste, biryani masala, salt, and a pinch of sugar until well combined.

steps.title: Marinate the mutton
steps.description: Add the mutton to the marinade and coat evenly. Cover and refrigerate for at least 4 hours, preferably overnight.

steps.title: Prep the potatoes
steps.description: Peel the potatoes, cut them in half, and rub them with salt and turmeric.

steps.title: Fry the potatoes
steps.description: Heat mustard oil in a pan and shallow fry the potatoes until golden on all sides. Set aside.

steps.title: Slice the onions
steps.description: Thinly slice the onions for frying.

steps.title: Fry the onions (beresta)
steps.description: Deep fry the sliced onions in hot oil until golden brown and crisp. Drain on paper towels and set aside.

steps.title: Heat whole spices
steps.description: In a large heavy-bottom pot, heat mustard oil and add bay leaves, cloves, cardamoms, cinnamon, mace, and nutmeg.

steps.title: Cook the mutton
steps.description: Add the marinated mutton to the pot. Cook on medium-high heat until the meat starts to brown and the oil begins to separate.

steps.title: Add fried potatoes to mutton
steps.description: Once the mutton is nearly tender, add the fried potatoes and cook together for a few minutes to absorb flavor.

steps.title: Soak saffron
steps.description: In a small bowl, soak saffron strands in warm milk for 10 minutes.

steps.title: Add aromatic waters
steps.description: Mix rose water and kewra water into the saffron milk. Set aside.

steps.title: Parboil the rice
steps.description: Boil a large pot of water with salt and whole garam masalas. Add rinsed basmati rice and cook until 70% done. Drain immediately.

steps.title: Grease the biryani pot
steps.description: Lightly grease the base of a heavy-bottomed pot with ghee.

steps.title: First layer - mutton and potatoes
steps.description: Spread a layer of cooked mutton and potatoes at the bottom of the pot.

steps.title: Second layer - rice
steps.description: Add a layer of the parboiled rice over the mutton.

steps.title: Add toppings to layer
steps.description: Sprinkle fried onions, garam masala powder, a few drops of ghee, and a portion of the saffron milk mixture over the rice.

steps.title: Repeat layers
steps.description: Repeat the layering with the remaining mutton, rice, and toppings, finishing with rice on top.

steps.title: Seal the pot
steps.description: Cover the pot with a tight lid or seal it with dough to trap the steam.

steps.title: Dum cook the biryani
steps.description: Place the sealed pot over a low flame or a griddle and cook for 30â€“40 minutes to allow flavors to meld.

steps.title: Rest the biryani
steps.description: Turn off the heat and let the biryani rest, covered, for 10 minutes before opening.

steps.title: Serve
steps.description: Serve hot with boiled eggs, raita, or salad.
